comments.body:
took me a minute to parse this, but it evaluates to:
```
-p=
'{"spec":{"containers":[{"name": "kubernetes-serve-hostname", "image": "nginx"}]},"metadata":{"resourceVersion":"'
"$resourceVersion"
'"}}'
```

We could instead write the whole thing as a double quote string with escape sequences, but this change is smaller and "normal" shell (adjacent strings are concatenated even if alternating quote types, it's pretty common for concatenating literals with variable expansion like this)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +561,565 @@  ((resourceVersion+=100))
  # Command
  kubectl patch "${kube_flags[@]}" pod valid-pod -p='{"spec":{"containers":[{"name": "kubernetes-serve-hostname", "image": "nginx"}]},"metadata":{"resourceVersion":"'"$resourceVersion"'"}}' 2> "${ERROR_FILE}" || true
  # Post-condition: should get an error reporting the conflict
  if grep -q "please apply your changes to the latest version and try again" "${ERROR_FILE}"; then

comments.body: suggest deleting all of a different cluster-scoped object instead, like PersistentVolumes, where the command can actually succeed

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1329,1333 @@  kubectl create namespace my-namespace
  kube::test::get_object_assert 'namespaces/my-namespace' "{{$id_field}}" 'my-namespace'
  output_message=$(! kubectl delete namespace -n my-namespace --all 2>&1 "${kube_flags[@]}")
  kube::test::if_has_string "${output_message}" 'warning: deleting cluster-scoped resources'
  kube::test::if_has_string "${output_message}" 'namespace "my-namespace" deleted'

comments.body: Same as above. I don't think the test here is necessary. These tests are used primarily to verify kubectl.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@  kube::log::status "Testing configmaps"
  kubectl create -f test/fixtures/doc-yaml/user-guide/configmap/configmap.yaml
  kube::test::get_object_assert 'configmap/test-configmap' "{{$id_field}}" 'test-configmap'
  kubectl delete configmap test-configmap "${kube_flags[@]}"
